Dear Ms. Reynolds:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4147 Dental care
(2) A dental examination within 12 months prior to
admission shall be documented or there shall
be an examination not later than 90 calendar
days following admission.
One out of one applicable files for current youth did not contain a dental
appointment within the first 90 days of placement, and the facility could not
confirm that the youth had a dental appointment in the previous 12 months.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(g) If the employee has criminal convictions, the
institution shall complete a written
evaluation of the convictions that addresses

the nature of the conviction, the length of
time since the conviction, and the
relationship of the conviction to regulated
activity for the purpose of determining
suitability for employment in the institution.
One out of one applicable newly hired employee files with criminal history
reviewed did not have an assessment of their criminal history authored by the
program prior to hire.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records

any convictions.
One out of one applicable newly hired employee files with criminal history
reviewed did not have an assessment of their criminal history authored by the
individual prior to hire.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following

(j) A written evaluation of the employee’s
performance within 30 days of the completion
of the probationary period or within 180 days,
whichever is less, and a written evaluation of
the employee’s performance annually
thereafter.
One out of two applicable newly hired employees had their initial performance
evaluation completed later than 180 days after hire.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Documentation of job descriptions and their provision to staff at the time of hire.
• Documentation of initial efforts to enroll youth in school within the program.

• Documentation of discharge service planning and the communication of
elements of that with applicable parties.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Efforts to capture immunization information and documentation of those efforts.
• Efforts to receive authority to provide necessary medical treatment from courts
outside of the local county.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: A
Corrective Action Plan was created as a result of the last interim inspection, dated
02/28/2023. This involved preliminary, ongoing and discharge service plans and
action planning involving further training and periodic checks of completed service
plans by administration. The facility was compliant with this CAP as no repeat
violations were found for these rules.
A Corrective Action Plan was also written as a result of one Licensing
investigation. 2023C0000760SI was dated 12/04/2023 and involved re-training
and reconsideration of lockdown policies. To this date the facility has been in
compliance with this Corrective Action Plan in that staff have been trained and
there has been once instance where lockdown procedures were utilized and done
so correctly.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting and financial overviews were provided, and no concerns were
noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator report dated 12/20/2023 was provided and reviewed. The
interim inspection corrective action plan was reviewed and it was noted that there
was only one unplanned discharge that occurred in 2023.

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed on 12/19/2023. They all reported consistent work
experiences with the program in feeling well trained and supported by
management.
Youth were interviewed on 12/19/2023. Youth placed reported being well taken
care of, including food and clothing provisions, ability to care for themselves as
needed and feeling safe in the program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Facility was toured on 12/19/2023. It was in a clean and organized condition.
Medications were noted as stored properly, and cleaning items were stored in a
safe manner.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
